results.title: Home front: 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Annice Vass and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Newsreels of Australia during World War II including diggers marching to the war, Prime Minister Curtin addressing the nation, the War Fund Parades, panic buying, the Japanese bombing of Darwin, the Land Army women and the civilian war effort. The final segments look at the Peace celebrations of 1945.

results.title: Home from the Hill
results.creator_credit: Molly Dineen and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: After forty years of service in India and Africa, Colonel Hilary Hook returns home to England. We follow his journey from his Kenyan home and servants to an England very different from the one he left in 1948. This is a documentary about a dying breed of colonials. Colonel Hook represents those who once thought it was their responsibility to civilise the world, or a good part of it, only to find the world changing too fast for them to keep up. The pride with which Hook was prepared to cope, and the occasional despair when things proved too difficult, make him an absorbing central character and a remarkable microcosm of the fading British Empire. Rated: G

results.title: Home free
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates and Fruits and Roots Production
results.brief_description: Reverses the traditional story of the ethnic child assimilated into Western culture by placing a ten-year-old white girl into a new cultural environment - a Chinese neighbourhood. Conveys the mystery, threat and strangeness of the “new” community as experienced by the girl. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Home care
results.brief_description: Based upon the experience of Montefiore Hospital, New York, this film depicts home care programs as an effective approach toward the treatment of patients with chronic disease, and shows such are of patients with cancer, heart disease, asthma, arthritis and other conditions. Discusses factors considered in the selection of patients for home care and the role of the doctor, nurse and social worker in the treatment.

results.title: Home at seven
results.creator_credit: Eric Muller, Paul Gray, British Information Services and Vauxhall Motors Film Unit
results.brief_description: The reliability of the modern British motor-car owes much to the skill of the designers and engineers associated with the development of a new model. Describes the design, manufacture, and testing of Vauxhall cars, with emphasis on reliable performance under hard, daily motoring conditions. Skills involved in preparing for a mass production run are also illustrated.

results.title: Home and school
results.creator_credit: Gerry Bryant, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of two typical well-meaning parents who provide everything they possibly can for the physical well-being of their children; consequently, they fail to understand why their children are so often disobedient, defiant, and generally unmanageable. In desperation, the mother seeks the advice of the headmistress of the children’s school; both parents later attend a meeting of the Parents and Teachers Association, and learn something of the methods and aims of modern education. They apply what they have learned to their relationships with their own children, with gratifying results.

results.title: Home and dry (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A brief explanation of incontinence, its causes and treatment. Discusses how it may be managed and how it can often be cured. The majority of suferers have “disorders of nervous control of micturition”. Incontinence is a common presenting symptom of disease in old age.

results.title: Home and away (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The most important event in the life of most five year olds is starting school. With this comes a widening of relationships to include teachers and friends. It is not always an easy step and some children are disturbed by it.
